arm_group.arm_group_label: 8mmHg intraperitoneal pressure with cool, dry CO2 gas (n=20)

brief_summary.textblock:
Use lay language.

      The primary purpose is to compare the impacts of intraperitoneal pressure (8mmHg versus 12
      mmHg) and CO2 gas (cool, dry CO2 gas versus warmed, humidified CO2 gas) on gene expression
      in peritoneal tissues during laparoscopic surgery. We hypothesize that combined use of a low
      Intraperitoneal pressure (8mmHg) and warmed, humidified CO2 gas during CO2 pneumoperitoneum
      may be better in minimizing adverse effects on surgical peritoneal environment and improving
      clinical outcomes compared to the standard intraperitoneal pressure (12mmHg) and standard
      cool, dry CO2 gas.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impacts of Intraperitoneal Pressure and CO2 Gas on Surgical Peritoneal Environment

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients undergoing laparoscopic hysterectomy with promontofixation are randomized into four
      groups: Group 1: 12mmHg intraperitoneal pressure with cool, dry CO2 gas (n=20), Group 2:
      12mmHg intraperitoneal pressure with warmed, humidified CO2 gas (n=20), Group 3: 8mmHg
      intraperitoneal pressure with cool, dry CO2 gas (n=20), Group 4: 8mmHg intraperitoneal
      pressure with warmed, humidified CO2 gas (n=20).

      Normal peritoneum is collected from the parietal wall at the beginning of laparoscopic
      surgery and at 1 and 2 hours. Expression of genes encoding components of the fibrinolytic
      system, extracellular matrix and adhesion molecules, and inflammatory cytokine signaling
      molecules in peritoneal tissues are measured by real-time PCR.

      Quality of post-operative recovery by QoR-40, post-operative pain by Visual Analog Scale,
      per or post operative complications and intraoperative core temperature are assessed and
      compared.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 45-75 years old

          -  Petients undergoing laparoscopic hysterectomy with promontofixation for uterine
             prolapse

          -  Menopaused

          -  ASA class I or II

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Absolute contraindications to laparoscopy

          -  Previous history of pelvic surgery, endometriosis and/or infection

          -  Pathological peritoneal tissue

          -  BMI more than 30

          -  Height less than 150cm

arm_group_label: 8mmHg intraperitoneal pressure with cool, dry CO2 gas (n=20)
intervention.description: Humidification to 98% relative humidity, and warming to 37 degrees C of laparoscopic insufflate. This will be done for the duration of the operation

clinical_study.official_title: A Single-blind, Randomized Study to Compare Impacts of Intraperitoneal Pressure (8mmHg Versus 12 mmHg) and CO2 Gas (Cool, Dry CO2 Gas Versus Warmed; Humidified Co2 Gas) on Surgical Peritoneal Environment During Laparoscopic Surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Expression of genes encoding components of the fibrinolytic system, extracellular matrix and adhesion molecules, and inflammatory cytokine signalling molecules in peritoneal tissues

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
